hero.name: Krystal Elliott
hero.title: Software Engineer
hero.tagline: Building resilient systems with precision and purpose

about.summary: I'm a software engineer who bridges the gap between technical and human-centric development. With experience in quality assurance, project management, and a degree in English, I bring a comprehensive perspective to building resilient systems. I'm passionate about continuous learning and creating software that truly serves people.
about.unique: What sets me apart is my comprehensive perspective and people-first approach. I don't just build systems—I create solutions that truly serve people, combining technical precision with genuine understanding of user needs.

story.journey: My journey began with a degree in English Literature, fueled by a love of analysis and language. I wanted to teach at the high school level, because I believe deeply in the power of literacy and mentorship, but during my time as a teaching assistant, I witnessed systemic gaps that told me I needed to reevaluate where I could channel my love of critical thinking. Thankfully, a friend introduced me to programming in 2012 and I have been hooked since. I decided to try again and started my Software Engineering degree in 2013. Software engineering feels like magic to me—I love bringing ideas to life with technology. As a purpose-driven individual, it is my hope to one day be a part of a team who builds something with real world impact. I have had a lot of interesting life experiences and every step has been driven by a desire to learn, create, and make a meaningful impact.

milestones.title: Penn State University
milestones.description: Began BS in Software Engineering, discovering my passion for building technology that matters (WE ARE!)

milestones.title: ARGO Data
milestones.description: Started as Application Developer I, quickly promoted to App Dev II—my first professional role building production software

milestones.title: Disney
milestones.description: Joined as Software Solutions Engineer, converted to FTE Software Engineer within a year—working on systems that bring magic to millions

milestones.title: Family Caregiver
milestones.description: Transitioned to full-time family caregiving, prioritizing what matters most while developing patience, resilience, and deep empathy... did I mention patience?

milestones.title: Germany
milestones.description: Family relocation to Munich—embracing new cultures, languages, and perspectives in the heart of Europe

milestones.title: Non-Profit Art
milestones.description: Started a small wood-burning art business to fundraise for refugees, combining creativity with community impact while applying agile development principles to product creation and business management

milestones.title: New Chapter
milestones.description: Envisioning a transition to a value-aligned full stack role, bringing a refreshed perspective and renewed passion to software engineering

interests.title: Creative Coding
interests.description: I love personal projects and experiments. From robotics kits to web applications, tinkering is how I learn and grow. Currently working with a Boe-Bot to learn about embedded software and robotics.

interests.title: Continuous Learning
interests.description: I'm passionate about staying current and expanding my skills. I dive into Data Structures & Algorithms through LeetCode and 'Cracking the Coding Interview.' For frameworks, I use Udemy and Codecademy—they've been invaluable resources throughout my journey.

interests.title: Fitness
interests.description: I go to the gym about 3 times a week. I start with cardio to get my heart pumping, then switch to lifting. Starting Strength and StrongLifts 5x5 have influenced my routine. I'm also getting more into stretching and yoga.

interests.title: Philanthropy
interests.description: I believe in giving back. Most recently, I worked with Family Gateway in Dallas, leading 12 coworkers in collecting funding and supplies for displaced families. We contributed over 30 backpacks, more than 1 ton of food, and 100+ toys for families in need.

interests.title: Art
interests.description: I love painting and drawing. All doodles on this site are my own. My kitties inspire me often, and I find creative expression to be a perfect balance to my technical work.

interests.title: Nature
interests.description: I'm in love with nature. After a long day of staring at screens, all I want is to be surrounded by trees and mountains. My first hiking trip was to Glendalough in Ireland. I've been hooked ever since.

lookingFor.collaboration: I'm always interested in hearing about new opportunities, collaborations, or just having a great conversation about technology and development.
